description: From Middle English wynturlych, from Old English winterlice; equivalent to winter +‎ -ly.

adjectives.description: winterly (comparative more winterly, superlative most winterly)

examples: One winterly day, about the year when you and I were concerned in being born, the engine-driver of a Scotch express received the ‘clear’ from a signal near a little Huntingdon station called Abbots Ripton. He went on and crashed into a goods train and into the thick of the smash a down express mowed its way.

entries.meaning: Of weather, etc, characteristic of winter.
